article.name: Set Up Multiple Phish Alert Button (PAB) Instances
article.title: Set Up Multiple Phish Alert Button (PAB) Instances
article.body:
You can set up multiple instances of the Phish Alert Button (PAB) for your organization to define unique settings, like prompt messages or languages, for specific users. Adding another PAB instance provides you with an additional license key for your new instance and a new set of editable settings.

We also offer a feature that allows you to add languages to your new or existing PAB instances. This version of the PAB provides you with a set of default languages that you can choose from to add to your Account Settings page. For more information, check out our Adding Languages to the Phish Alert Button article.

To set up another instance of the PAB, follow the steps below: 

  1. Log in to your KnowBe4 account.
  2. Click your email address on the top-right corner of the screen and then click Account Settings.

  3. Navigate to Account Integrations > Phish Alert.
  4. Click the Add Phish Alert Instance button.
  5. Review the prompt that displays and click Confirm.

  6. You'll see a new set of Phish Alert Settings to edit. Included with these new settings is a unique license key to use when installing this particular instance of the PAB. For more information on your configuration options, see our Phish Alert Button (PAB) Product Manual.
  7. Repeat steps one through six for additional PAB instances as needed.
  8. Install your new PAB instances using the instructions linked below:Hybrid Phish Alert Button (PAB) Product ManualWhen you access your Account Settings in the future, your PAB instances will be collapsed on your Account Settings page. You can click any instance's name to expand the settings for that particular instance.

You can also view information about your PAB instances on your KSAT Dashboard tab. For more information, see the Phish Alert Button section of our Dashboard article.

This image displays a **Confirmation Modal Dialog** used to verify a critical administrative action regarding Phish Alert settings.

**UI Elements and Context:**

*   **Title:** The dialog header, set in bold text, is **"Are you sure?"**
*   **Dismiss Control:** A gray 'X' icon is positioned in the upper right corner, allowing the user to close the dialog without proceeding.
*   **Warning Text (Body):** The main body provides a detailed warning and context for the attempted action. The exact text is:
    > "Creating another Phish Alert setting is only used if you need to have multiple configurations of the PAB in your organization. Once created additional configurations may not be deleted. Do you wish to continue?"
*   **Action Buttons (Footer):** Two rectangular buttons are presented for user response:
    1.  **Cancel:** A secondary action button rendered in dark gray, used to stop the current process.
    2.  **Confirm:** The primary action button rendered in bright green, used to accept the risk and proceed with creating the new, non-deletable configuration.
